alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jim Hogg and northern Zapata Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Aguilares, or 18 miles north of Bustamante, moving south or south-southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bustamante, Medina, Las Palmas, Randado, Thompsonville, Zapata County Airport, Escobas and Zapata--Medina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
